result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Morgan K Scarpino

records.addlTxt:
DEFENDANT MUST POST $2000 CASH

Defendant shall not drive a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license. Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH K.M.M. dob 10-9-1962 or RESIDENCE. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

Defendant Morgan K Scarpino in court, in custody by video.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Josh Ryan appeared. Defendant qualifies for SPD. Court inquired if victim wished to be heard; no statement made. Signature bond set, must post $2000 cash. Minutes filed.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 11, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
